message.content:
cs.AR, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.DC, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
- cs.AR (Hardware Architecture): The paper compares the performance of different convolution implementations on modern CPUs, which falls under the scope of hardware architecture.
- cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition): The paper evaluates the performance of the convolution implementations on two popular ConvNets (VGG and AlexNet), which are commonly used in computer vision tasks.
- cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing): The paper discusses the implementation of convolutional neural networks (ConvNet) and compares different approaches to optimize their performance.
- cs.DC (Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing): The paper evaluates the performance of the convolution implementations on multi- and many-core CPUs, which can be considered as parallel computing.
- cs.SY (Systems and Control): The paper analyzes the performance of the convolution implementations using a Roofline performance model, which can be considered as a control system for optimizing performance.
